TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
I would just like to thank [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) for creating this absolutely amazing mod.

![unknown.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/132478131490521089/326080662262120458/unknown.png)

![unknown.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/132478131490521089/326080701839441920/unknown.png)

![unknown.png?width=1080&height=607](https://images.discordapp.net/attachments/132478131490521089/326080571547582464/unknown.png?width=1080&height=607)

![unknown.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/132478131490521089/326080021406023680/unknown.png)

First of all, love the mod, thanks for the amazing work.

One quick question- is this in the image below a Scatterer issue? I know I saw a similar image somewhere a while ago and I believe I remember it being related to Scatterer, or some combination of it and another mod (I also have E.V.E. and S.V.E. installed). Squares of the terrain, no matter where I am on Kerbin, always start floating up like that when I'm landing. Always seems to happen during descent right between ~1500m and ~300m. Any feedback would be greatly appreciated.

[http://imgur.com/a/Qs3u5](http://imgur.com/a/Qs3u5)

![5uOev9W.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5uOev9W.jpg)

That's as may be, but please remember that modding is hard, time-consuming work that modders do in their spare time, for free, to give us all shiny new toys, for free.

Sure, this is a bug that I can well understand would be annoying to a player (though it's already been posted, multiple times, that there's a workaround-- just read the thread above).  I'm sure that the author of this mod is aware of the issue, and I can assure you that no modder likes there to be highly visible bugs in their mod, which after all is a labor of love.  Modders take pride in what they do.

But please remember that the amount of time it takes the modder to fix a given bug has nothing whatsoever to do with how annoying that bug may be to you.  And also remember that it's tedious, time-consuming work for the modder to do that.  And also that this isn't their *<u>job</u>*-- they've got real, actual lives IRL, like the rest of us, and any time the modder spends on modding is time they have to take away from their IRL responsibilities that obviously have higher priority (work, school, family, etc.)  And also that although you owe *<u>them</u>* a debt of gratitude for all the hard work they have done and continue to do on your behalf, they don't owe *<u>you</u>* anything, since they've done all this out of the goodness of their hearts.

That doesn't mean one shouldn't report bugs in mods.  Please do!  Modders love to know if there's a problem with their mods.  But while it's fine to *<u>report</u>* bugs... please don't *<u>complain</u>* about it.  In this particular case, plenty of people have already pointed out this particular bug, so there's no need to report it further, so, 'nuff said, yes?

It's great that there's such an active community of KSP modders to give us all these great, free, shiny toys.  Please remember that modders do this, unrewarded, for the sheer joy of it.  If a modder loses the joy, they stop modding, and then everybody loses.  Being a modder myself, I can attest that it's *<u>really</u>* not fun if someone's complaining (rather than offering helpful suggestions) about the thing you poured your heart and soul into to give them.  Saying "it's really bad and this is awful and we really need a fix right away" conveys no useful information and is unhelpful.

So... let's not get in the modder's way by jostling his elbow and breathing down his neck, shall we?

I am trying to get Scatterer working again, I have gone back to Ksp 1.2.2 removed all other mods, re-installed scatterer, and I get the config menu at the home screen but in game is completely stock.  As in scatterer is not doing anything, any ideas as to what might be wrong?

I've never had it happen w/Scatterer, but based on history...
